conbody.p: Euca2ools 3.3.0 has the following new features.

row.entry: Feature
Description
Improved client endpoint configuration.

Cloud users can obtain a list of the cloud's service endpoints in a simple way that is not conflated with credential creation.
euare-accountcreate, euare-usercreate, and euare-useraddkey gained a -w/--write-config option that allows them create new access keys and output a euca2ools.ini file instead of their usual output formats, simplifying credential distribution. The service URLs it generates will be based on the IAM service's DNS domain; if the IAM service is accessed by IP address, the output will not contain service URLs.
The -d/--domain option can be used to override this by choosing the domain name explicitly. Finally, the -l/--set-default-user option allows the output to set the given user as the default user for the region. Two examples are shown below:
euare-useraddkey alice -w > ~/.euca/alice.ini
euare-accountcreate bob -wld mycloud.example.com | mail -s "Your credentials" bob@example.com
Euca2ools 3.3.0 now requires version 0.4 of the requestbuilder python library.
If you install euca2ools with HP-provided RPM packages, requestbuilder will be installed automatically.
All commands use AWS signature version 4 for all services except S3.

It can additionally be enabled for S3 on a per-region basis with the s3-force-sigv4 region option in euca2ools.ini. Eucalyptus 4.2's object storage gateway is not compatible with AWS signature version 4.
Configuration for the retired Eucalyptus Community Cloud has been removed.
Eucalyptus Community Cloud has been integrated into the HP Helion community.
New load balancer commands.
Added load balancer commands to provide the ability to add, delete, and list ELB tags.
Added STS support to tools.
The euare-assumerole and euare-releaserole commands can now be used inside an eval shell command to assume IAM roles.
The EUARE_URL environment variable has been removed.
The AWS_IAM_URL variable is used instead.
For IAM commands that act on only one entity, those entities' names may now be supplied positionally.
For example, euare-usercreate alice works the same as euare-usercreate -u alice.
Two eucalyptus-specific services may now be specified in euca2ools.ini files.
bootstrap and properties services can be specified in the euca2ools.ini files.
